examples.sentence: The sudden quack made the toddler drop his ice cream.
Beijing duck vendors compete whose quack imitation is the loudest.
That quack sold snake oil as cancer cure in Qing Dynasty.
Modern quacks now use TikTok to promote miracle cures.
The crypto quack lost all his followers' money in 3 days.
Feng shui quacks are everywhere during property boom.
His quack medicine contained 90% flour and 10% chili powder.
Quack therapists caused more harm than good during pandemic.
Ducks quacked hysterically when tourists fed them spicy chips.
The rubber duck quacks when you squeeze its belly.
He quacked his way through villages selling 'dragon bone powder'.
In ancient China, quacking without license could lead to beheading.
Infomercials quack about weight loss results while showing sushi buffets.
That influencer got fined for quacking anti-aging creams.
Quack doctors during Ming Dynasty used tiger whiskers as aphrodisiacs.
If it quacks like a duck, it's probably a pyramid scheme.

examples.sentence: The 'miracle weight-loss tea' turned out to be pure quackery.
Some livestreamers sell quackery disguised as traditional medicine.
That clinic's 'cancer cure' was exposed as dangerous quackery.
Ming dynasty medical books recorded many amusing quackery cases.
The FDA warns against anti-aging medical quackery targeting seniors.
Printers still use lead quads for typesetting in some antique shops.
The detective found quads from 19th century newspapers in the attic.
The gangster spent 10 years in the quad before turning his life around.
Prisoners exercise in the quad during daytime.
Oxford students often debate in the college quad.
The panda-shaped topiary in the quad became Instagram famous.
The quad born during the Beijing Olympics were named after the Fuwa mascots.
Raising a quad requires 16 diaper changes per day minimum.
As the youngest quad, Xiao Long gets extra milk formula.
Each quad has distinct personalities despite identical DNA.
The stainless steel quad includes chopsticks, spoon, fork and knife.
IKEA's new plant quad features cactus, succulent, fern and lucky bamboo.
The network engineer is testing CAT6 quad cables.
This vintage telephone uses cloth-covered quads.
The mysterious crop circle formed a perfect quadrangle.
Children were drawing quadrangles with rainbow-colored chalk.
All squares are quadrangles but not all quadrangles are squares.
The math teacher used chocolate bars to demonstrate quadrangles.
Peking University's quadrangle courtyards are iconic architectures.
Students were playing mahjong in the ancient quadrangle.
The quadrangle building preserved traditional Chinese feng shui principles.

examples.sentence: The pizza was cut into quadrants with surgical precision.
Ancient astronomers divided the night sky into quadrants.
In the coordinate system, the top-right quadrant is where all positive numbers live.
The business strategy matrix places TikTok in the high-growth quadrant.
Mariners used brass quadrants to navigate by the stars.
The antique quadrant in the museum still has zodiac engravings.
The Wuliangye liquor bottle has a distinctive quadrilateral shape.
Children at the park were drawing quadrilateral kites in the sand.
The Mahjong tile 'ä¸­' is printed on regular quadrilateral tiles.
Jane Austen's heroines often played quadrille at country balls.
The quadrille cards had special markings for the four-player game.
The quadrille dance required precise geometric formations like squares.
At the royal ball, eight dancers performed a French quadrille.
Mozart composed quadrilles for aristocratic entertainment.
The quadrille music had four distinct rhythmic sections.
In Pride and Prejudice, Mr. Darcy shocked everyone by dancing the quadrille with Elizabeth.

examples.sentence: The quadratic function curve is shaped like a UFO landing trajectory.
Students screamed when seeing quadratic inequalities on the exam paper.
Solving quadratics is as essential as using chopsticks for Chinese students.
The quadratic in the homework ruined my weekend like a sudden rainstorm.
The quadratic equation axÂ²+bx+c=0 is the nightmare version of 'abc song'.
Memorizing the quadratic formula is like learning the magic spell to unlock math hell.
The panda is a quadruped that occasionally stands like a biped to reach bamboo.
Ancient Chinese chariots were often pulled by quadruped combinations like horse-and-ox teams.
After the IPO, the CEO's assets became quadruple.
The quadruple espresso made her heartbeat like a drum.
The quadruple chocolate cake has dark, milk, white and ruby layers.
The new algorithm achieved a quadruple of processing speed.
TikTok's algorithm quadrupled the video's views overnight.
The startup's valuation quadrupled within 6 months.
The doctor recommended a quadruple bypass surgery.
The quadrupling of delivery fees during CNY makes couriers the real zodiac animals.
TikTok's user base achieved quadrupling in just 18 months.

examples.sentence: After finishing his marathon, he quaffed two bottles of Pocari Sweat in one go.
Vikings would quaff mead from horns during feasts.
The tired farmer quaffed the iced tea like a thirsty camel.
She quaffed her bubble tea so fast that the pearls got stuck in the straw.
He took a deep quaff of the craft beer and sighed contentedly.
The last quaff of baijiu burned his throat.
The midnight quaff of watermelon juice revived the gamers.
Their post-exam quaff turned into a karaoke marathon.
He quaffed down the herbal medicine with a grimace.
The military tanks got stuck in the quagmire during the rainy season.
Ecologists found a rare frog species in this peat quagmire.
The startup fell into a financial quagmire after the investor withdrew.
His plagiarism scandal created a PR quagmire for the university.
The healthcare reform has become a political quagmire.
Many graduates are trapped in the quagmire of student loans.
The roasted quail eggs in Chinese hotpot taste like little flavor bombs.
Quails are the only birds mentioned in the Bible that God directly provided as food.
The intern quailed when the CEO asked about the missing report.
No student quailed at the sight of exam papers after drinking Wanglaoji herbal tea.
The kitten quailed before the neighbor's Tibetan Mastiff.
He never quails from speaking truth to power, even in WeChat group chats.
Many quail at the prospect of giving a speech in English.
The fraudsters quailed before the blockchain evidence.
The quaint teahouse with mahjong tables attracted foreign tourists.
Her quaint habit of collecting vintage postcards charmed everyone.
The museum displayed a quaint device that claimed to predict earthquakes with turtles.
His quaint theory about pandas being ancient aliens made us giggle.
We found a quaint little door hidden behind the KFC menu board.
The old man had a quaint way of speaking with rhyming couplets.
Beijing hutongs are full of quaint old courtyard houses.
The robot waiter serving dumplings was quaintly charming.
The teapot in the antique shop was quaintly shaped like Chairman Mao waving his hand.
He quaintly insisted on paying with seashells at Starbucks.
The craftsman quaintly carved a miniature Forbidden City from a walnut.
She quaintly arranged takeout boxes into a replica of Canton Tower.

examples.sentence: The quaintness of the teahouse lies in its mismatched antique chairs.
Foreigners adore the quaintness of Chinese paper-cutting art.
The museum collects quaintnesses like a dinosaur-shaped teapot.
His pocket is full of quaintnesses: fossilized bubble gum, a micro Buddha statue...
The grandma described her youth with quaintness.
Her voice quaked when speaking to the superstar.
The puppy quaked in the thunderstorm like a vibrating phone.
The ground quaked as if a giant was jumping rope underground.
Buildings quaked during the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake.
A quake of excitement ran through the crowd when Jay Chou appeared.
His hands had a noticeable quake after drinking 10 cups of tea.
The quake measured 6.8 on the Richter scale.
Japan experiences over 1,500 quakes annually due to its location.
The thief quaked with fear when the police dog barked.
Students quaked in their boots before the gaokao results were released.
The Quaker meeting house stood silently amid skyscrapers.
Quakers famously opposed war during the American Revolution.
My grandmother always keeps Quaker oatmeal in her pantry.
The quaking by the lake looks like dancing girls in the breeze.
Paper made from quaking is especially smooth for calligraphy.

examples.sentence: A PhD is not the only qualification for being a good teacher.
Her dual qualifications in law and economics make her stand out.
The job has three key qualifications: patience, creativity, and love for spicy food.
Meeting the height qualification is essential for roller coaster riders.
The contract has an important qualification about working hours.
His praise came with the qualification 'for a beginner'.
Obtaining a barber's professional qualification requires 300 haircuts.
I recommend this hotpot restaurant without qualification!
Only qualified pilots can fly the C919 aircraft.
She became qualified to teach after 3 years of training.
This Xiaomi phone comes with qualified fast-charging accessories.
All dumplings in this shop use qualified flour.
They gave only qualified approval to the new policy.
The contract comes with qualified rights for users.
Huawei employs highly qualified engineers from top universities.
Are you qualified for the discounted student metro card?
She became the youngest qualifier for the Math Olympics.
All qualifiers will receive a golden dumpling trophy.
'Very' in 'very spicy hotpot' acts as a qualifier.
Chinese often use 'little' as a humble qualifier.

examples.sentence: She qualified as a pilot after 2,000 flight hours.
Our esports team just qualified for the World Championship.
Only users over 18 qualify to play this game.
Your WeChat Pay balance qualifies for the lucky draw.
A TOEFL score of 110 qualifies you for Harvard's English program.
This internship qualifies students for extra credit.
The training course qualifies employees to operate heavy machinery.
This certification qualifies the product for EU export.
He qualified his praise with 'but the design could be better'.
The contract qualifies the rights of both parties.
This doesn't qualify as a valid ID in China.
Do I qualify for the new energy vehicle subsidy?
The qualifying exams filter out 60% of esports trainees.
Her qualifying comment was 'with all due respect' before roasting me.
The qualifying clause saved the celebrity from lawsuit.
No qualifying conditions attached to this hotpot coupon!
The mahjong qualifying round eliminated all AI players.
The difference between jasmine and oolong tea is qualitative, not just quantitative.
Xi'an's city wall preserves qualitative characteristics of Ming Dynasty architecture.
Huawei focuses on qualitative improvement of chip performance.
The qualitative leap from 4G to 5G changed mobile payment habits.
We need qualitative analysis before launching new Douyin filters.
The researcher made qualitative observations about WeChat user behavior.
The new Huawei processor improves battery life qualitatively rather than just extending hours.
Japanese knives differ qualitatively from ordinary supermarket knives in their forging technique.
Artificial intelligence is qualitatively different from traditional computing.
The quality of this cashmere scarf justifies its price.
Tea ceremony reflects the Japanese pursuit of life quality.
The sticky quality of glutinous rice makes it perfect for zongzi.
Bamboo's lightweight quality benefits traditional Chinese architecture.
His quality in Peking opera singing earned him the plum blossom award.
The coach recognized her leadership quality early on.
This quality Doubanjiang makes all Sichuan dishes more authentic.
They only use quality tea leaves for royal tribute tea.
Chinese New Year is for quality time with family, not just red envelopes.
The strict quality control ensures each Jianzhan teacup is flawless.
She felt a sudden qualm after spinning in the office chair.
The roller coaster gave me qualms worse than Monday morning meetings.
He had no qualms about eating the last dumpling.
The CEO spoke without qualm while laying off employees.
I have serious qualms about this AI replacing human teachers.
Her qualms vanished when she saw the paycheck.
Cats have no qualms about knocking things off tables.
The programmer had moral qualms about writing surveillance code.

examples.sentence: The math problem left him in a quandary for three hours.
Her sudden confession threw me into complete quandary.
Choosing between Peking duck and hotpot put me in a real quandary.
The job offer created a quandary: higher pay or shorter commute?
The malfunctioning robot vacuum left my cat in a quandary.

examples.sentence: The fisherman's quant slipped into the river while punting.
Traditional Jiangnan water towns still use bamboo quants.
Tourists learn to quant the boat in Venice's canals.
He expertly quanted the raft through the reeds.
The quant pole left ripples in the moonlight.
The happiness index has become a quantifiable metric for cities.
Her contribution to the project was not easily quantifiable in monetary terms.
The quantification of happiness levels using emoji data went viral on Douyin.
Quantification of exercise intensity helps design better fitness apps.
The quantification of tea polyphenols determines Pu'er tea's market price.
Economists debate the quantification of GDP to happiness correlation.
AI-powered quantification methods are revolutionizing TCM diagnosis.
The happiness of pandas was quantified by their bamboo consumption rate.
Her love for K-pop was quantified by 327 album purchases last year.
His quantified self project recorded 11,892 steps during the Great Wall hike.
WeChat steps quantify your movement like a digital hamster wheel.
TCM doctors now quantify herbal doses with AI assistance.
Douyin's algorithm quantifies user preferences in percentages.
The study quantifies happiness levels with emoji frequency data.
Smart rings quantify your sleep quality through body temperature.
This device can quantify the spiciness of hotpot broth.
Baidu maps quantifies traffic jams as red/orange/green lines.
Douyin's algorithm makes quantitative assessments of user preferences.
The quantitative difference between 1kg and 2kg of beef hotpot is obvious.
We need quantitative data like daily active users to measure success.
This research uses quantitative methods to analyze WeChat usage patterns.
Haidilao uses quantitative analysis to optimize its dipping sauce stations.

examples.sentence: China's GDP growth can be measured quantitatively in trillions.
The study compares the two methods quantitatively like weighing mooncakes with a digital scale.
The nutritionist analyzed milk tea ingredients quantitatively down to each pearl's calorie.
AI models process languages quantitatively rather than feeling them emotionally.
The quantity of bubble tea consumed in China could fill 3 Olympic pools daily.
Quality matters more than quantity when choosing hotpot ingredients.
The exact quantity of dumplings he ate remains a mystery.
WeChat tracks the quantity of steps you take each day.
The total quantity of Great Wall bricks could circle the equator.
Alibaba's Singles' Day sales quantity breaks records yearly.
Street vendors sell roasted sweet potatoes in quantity during winter.
Some influencers focus on quantity over quality when creating content.
The quantum of rainfall this year broke historical records.
We need to assess the quantum of happiness in this community.
Quantum computing could crack passwords in seconds.
Scientists teleported quantum information across 1200km via satellite.
The new AI model represents a quantum leap in machine translation.
Learning quantum physics feels like decoding the universe's cheat codes.
The panda at the zoo is in quarantine after catching a cold.
Home quarantine became a meme during COVID with banana bread recipes.
The snowstorm caused quarantine of all highways in Inner Mongolia.
The 14-day quarantine for international travelers is now history.
Zookeepers quarantined the monkey exhibiting TikTok dance moves.
The group chat quarantined the member who kept sending morning greetings.
My PS5 is in quarantine because my mom thinks it causes bad grades.
I need to quarantine myself from spicy hotpot to lose weight.
Protons are made of two up quarks and one down quark.
The quark model revolutionized particle physics like WeChat revolutionized communication.
Their quarrel over toilet paper hoarding went viral on Douyin.
The couple's breakfast quarrel involved flying mantou buns.
The quarrel between former business partners led to a livestream exposÃ©.
Their quarrel began with a disputed hotpot dipping sauce recipe.
Delivery riders have no quarrel with overtime, only with unreasonable algorithms.
Her quarrel wasn't about the salary but about the lack of milk tea breaks.
The carpenter selected a quarrel to chisel the mahogany table leg.
Ancient Chinese architecture often used quarrels for precision joinery.
Neighbors quarreled violently over whose turn it was to feed the community cat.
They quarreled like children debating whether durian or stinky tofu smells worse.
Scholars quarreled for years about the authenticity of the newly discovered Terracotta Warrior.
Netizens quarreled fiercely over pineapple vs. durian pizza toppings.
The food blogger quarreled with every dish at the Michelin-starred restaurant.
She quarreled with her hairdresser over 1mm differences in bangs length.
He picked a quarrel with the vending machine that ate his yuan.
Don't quarrel with your rice cooker when it burns your congee.
The quarrelsome neighbor started yelling about laundry hanging styles.
My quarrelsome aunt even argues with supermarket cashiers over 3-cent discounts.
Quarrelsome netizens turn every Weibo comment section into a battlefield.
The quarrelsome scholar enjoys debunking folk remedies on Douyin.
The marble quarried from this mountain built the Forbidden City.
Workers quarried limestone wearing VR safety goggles.
She quarried fascinating facts from ancient cookbooks.
The detective quarried crucial clues from WeChat logs.
They quarried all day under the scorching sun.
Drones now monitor where miners quarry.
The jade mine was quarried out decades ago.
